letter:
Dear [Boss's Name],

I hope this message finds you well. I want to take a moment to express my sincerest apologies for the recent mishandling of the client relationship with [Client's Name]. I deeply regret my actions and the impact they had on our team and the trust we have built with our clients.

I understand that my oversight not only affected our reputation but may also have caused additional stress for you and the team. I take full responsibility for my mistakes and the miscommunication I allowed to occur. It was never my intention to jeopardize our relationship with such an important client, and I am genuinely sorry for the consequences of my actions.

I have reflected on what went wrong and am committed to learning from this experience. I am taking steps to ensure that I communicate more effectively in the future and will seek guidance when needed to avoid similar issues. I value the trust you place in me, and I am determined to regain your confidence.

Thank you for your understanding and support during this time. I appreciate the opportunity to learn and grow from this situation, and I am focused on making amends moving forward.

Sincerely,

[Your Name]  
[Your Position]
